creator: xantius@xantius.com
text:
Error pages are displaying server signature details despite ServerSignature
being set to Off.

I am running Debian Sarge, a fresh install as of about 3 months ago.  I'm using
Apache 2.52.  I've searched all the config's I can find and done recursive greps
to find any that could have been hiding and find no other instance of
ServerSignature, but the error pages still produce a signature.  After some
investigation, it looks as though it's simply a bad setup in the bottom.html
include file.  This extra information only shows up when mod_include is being used.

Well, then change the bottom.html. The customized error pages are simple SSI
pages, which cannot know about ServerSignature.
creator: nd@perlig.de
rici@ricilake.net
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Well, then change the bottom.html. The customized error pages are simple SSI
> pages, which cannot know about ServerSignature.

Actually, the SSI pages could use SERVER_SIGNATURE, whose value is based on the setting of the 
ServerSignature directive, rather than SERVER_SOFTWARE, which is based on the ServerTokens directive. 
So I would say that it is a bug in docs/error/include/bottom.html
